intro: Erycibe sangiheensis, commonly known as the Sangihe beautyberry, is a flowering plant native to the island of Sangihe in Indonesia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking purple to red berries that mature in late summer. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a glossy texture, while the flowers are small and clustered in umbels. The berries are not only ornamental but also serve as a food source for various wildlife species.
